briefTitle: Retapamulin as a Decolonizing Agent for MRSA
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial of the Efficacy of Retapamulin as a Topical Decolonizing Agent for Mupirocin Resistant Methicillin Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus (MRSA)
summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the efficacy of retapamulin to reduce carriage of MRSA via a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical study testing retapamulin among patients with confirmed mupirocin-resistant nasal and/or rectal MRSA colonization. The sample size will include 27 subjects in each of the two arms of the study (retapamulin versus placebo) for a total of 54 subjects. Participants who are found to be nasal and/or rectal colonized with MRSA will be randomized to receive either retapamulin or placebo applied nasally and rectally for a total of 5 days. Nasal and rectal swabs will be collected at pre-defined time points during study duration (screening swab, swab one week after completion of topical therapy, swab 4 weeks after completion of topical therapy) to assess MRSA colonization status. The colonization rates of both groups will be assessed via Fisher's Exact Test.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With MRSA Carriage at 1 Week Post Decolonization With Retapamulin or Placebo
